title: Riot's (Bad) Philosophy is Damage = Fun
body:
Riot's philosophy of Damage = Fun can actually be tracked down to earlier more balanced seasons. Their reasoning for way back in the tank meta, just in one example, a full armor/health rammus doing half a squishies health (that was actually alot of damage back then) with one combo: Damage = Fun.

In other words they made tanks do a disproportionately unfair amount of damage, even ones that don't build any damage items whatsoever, because less people would play tank designed champions that are just damage soakers/cc bots. Can that not simply be what tanks are instead of needing a now 2000 true damage ult? (Cho'gath)

History of just a few meta solutions Rito has had over my long time with this game:
Mages too weak? Introduce CDR items and runes so that they can constantly spam their abilities and put out more damage (at which point timing ult cooldowns to strategize around became practically irrelevant, now you just use ult, back, get in lane and ult is probably back up again).
Games too long? Increased damage towards towers!
Tanks too strong? Increase damage with increased armor pen/magic pen, and later even more with true damage.
ADC's too strong now? We'll nerf crit, essentially INCREASING EARLY GAME DAMAGE (which is now the whole game btw) by making only lethality, high early game damage strategies viable.

Edit: I should say I do have fun still in the game, but mostly just in the first 10 minutes trying to beat my lane opponent. By about 15 minutes it is very obvious whether we're absolutely stomping them or getting absolutely stomped. Absolutely stomping an opponent that I know just can't come back isn't that satisfying, and getting absolutely stomped is a terrible experience right now because you just can't come back.

I agree that Conqueror is a big mistake.  I understand what they were trying to do by allowing Bruisers to beat up tanks, it's brutally overtuned and when champs like Yi and Jax etc are using it, it's totally broken.  

Tanks ARE doing too much damage, I agree, but there's no reason they shouldn't be able to kill squishy enemies.  They shouldn't be able to do it as fast as assassins (Malph's ult-combo is like 100>0 sometimes), but they should be able to beat a lot of targets down eventually if they're ahead or they're able to stick on a squishier target.  If the tanks don't have at least meaningful damage, they're not going to be played.  Most bruisers these days have some crowd control of their own, so if you make tanks hit like wet noodles, bruisers will take over the role entirely.  

Infinity Edge rework was not a mistake.  It was sorely needed.  Additional tuning maybe needed, but it was too much of a does-everything item and served as an absurd mid game power spike.

Tanks doing no damage isn't a problem.  Bruisers basically being tanks with better damage is.  Those two roles constantly switch spots in the meta all the time due to how similar they are and Riot should have a historical precedent to know not to overreact to one being stronger than the other.  And besides that they've created situations where tanks do equal damage to bruisers while being way better at cc/durability and they've created situations where the tanks can't do reasonable damage wheras bruisers are able to be about as durable while doing it.  And the current situation is one where bruisers are able to just stack defense while having absurd damage with Conquerer so history is repeating itself once again, or they can just go full damage and compete with assassins for their role.

And games being too long is complaining about the game being too passive and stalling to 50 minutes, not complaining about 30-40 minute average games.  It's not fun spending an hour doing nothing but farming.  It's also not fun getting blown up in literally 1-2 abilities even if you buy defense.  And I don't recall any complaints about a "stale meta" other than people wanting different roles in botlane, which they successfully did... by deleting 80% of adcs from the role lol.  Riot does change for the sake of change all the time so other than leaving a busted item like Ardent Censer in the game for 6 months there's been few periods where the meta has been allowed to just stagnate.

I can see how Riot falls into this line of thinking, though. Dealing damage is fun. Not dealing any damage whatsoever is not fun. Now obviously if you're 0/3/0 and put yourself in that position, then you should have played more carefully. But generally speaking, dealing very little damage is not fun.

What Riot's been doing, though, is thinking that MORE DAMAGE = MORE FUN. Which is not the case.

Hell that is one of the reasons why I believe that heal/shield power SHOULD stay as it allows supports to have enough power to be effective without having to full AP or full damage and lose out on utility or be able to do both.

What needs to be done is better tuning of damage, there is too much of it and tank items don't feel like they are that effective while skirmishers now have insane damage and survivability to go in and deal insane amounts of damage without dying despite having little to no raw tankiness.

> Not everyone should have damage or be able to build it

Well if you don't want supports to be able to build damage why wouldn't you want them to build AP and just make all of their AP scalings into utility scaling meaning that no matter how much AP they build they still won't deal more damage (unless they build Lich Bane or build AD)
I think it's totally fine, if people find it fun then why the hell not, I think it's super good.

There is a point where "this makes it more fun for the player" ends up making the game unfun for everyone else, and when you only benefit from 1 op champion yourself, but play agianst 5 op champions, you have no fun whatsoever

They noticed that many people were fine with "stomp/be stomped" games even 1 year ago, and made it worse.
Stomp? Oh, I'm so good.
Stomped? My team sucks.

Meanwhile, every game is a pointless one-shot fiesta. You can engage on a tank and get kills, instead of getting punished for being mindless.
You just need to burst your enemy before your enemy bursts you.
Fun game.
